results.title: Snakes and ladders
results.creator_credit: Trish FitzSimons, Mitzi Goldman and Wisteria Films
results.brief_description: An experimental documentary which looks at the history of women and their education through a series of film clips, old footage, animation and interviews. Sophia Whist is a character on a journey of enquiry. She discovers an old book in the public library which comes alive. In its pages she meets ten women between the ages of 16 and 94, who talk about their education. Their stories are about wanting an education, wanting more from their education, fighting to extend their options, and demanding to be taught material that incorporates the experience of women. They reveal how women’s achievements in one generation are often hidden in the next making it difficult for women to draw on the wealth of knowledge and experience of their predecessors. Cast: Robin Laurie.

results.title: Snow cat: based on the book by Dayal Kaur Khalsa
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, Marcy Page, Kenneth Hirsch, National Film Board of Canada and Snow Cat Productions
results.brief_description: On a cold snowy afternoon, a grandmother captivates her granddaughter’s attention with the tale of a lonely girl and a magic cat. A story of enduring love by artist and filmmaker Sheldon Cohen, recipient of many prestigious prizes, including the British Academy Award. In ‘Snow cat’ he works collaboratively with animator Jeami, who designed an original finger-paint technique for the film.
results.title_for_label: Snow cat: based on the book by Dayal Kaur Khalsa

results.title: Snow
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Snow has a kind of life: it changes form or “ripens,” its very whiteness serves a purpose. In this film you see frost crystals forming in the upper atmosphere, delicate filigree flakes that, settling on the ground, by sheer weight of numbers clog our roads and driveways. The film shows why powder snow is a favorite of skiers, and why corn snow may, in high places, warn of developing avalanches.

results.title: Smuggler's Cove
results.creator_credit: Peter Sharp, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions
results.brief_description: A day surfing for a group of teenagers turns into the adventure of a lifetime when they stumble across a group of cut-throat drug smugglers. Based on the novel, “Deadman’s float” by Roger Carr and starring Sally Boyden, Greg Rowe, Bill Hunter, Gus Mercurio, Ernie Sigley and Bunney Brooke.

results.title: Smoking, Drinking and Drugs (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This animated film, featuring puppets, provides children with information to enable them to make their own decisions about smoking, drinking and drugs. The characters explain how the body becomes dependent on tobacco, alcohol and other drugs and how people’s health and lives are affected. It provides children with reasons to resist the external pressures to take up these habits.

results.title: Snapshot = Day after Halloween = Day before Halloween [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Antony Ginnane, William Fayman, Barbi Taylor and Australian International Film Corporation
results.brief_description: For his film debut director Simon Wincer chose to tread the well-chartered territory of the horror thriller, in which the life for an innocent character is irretrievably changed through a combination of naivety and bad encounters. Angela, a young hairdresser with modelling ambitions, is talked into posing nude for a photo in order to attract attention. Soon enough, the attention is transformed in stalking, complete with the discovery of a pig’s head in her bed. Of the sleazy producer, the eccentric magazine producer and the clingy ex-boyfriend — who wants Angela dead and why? Reference: Greg Kerr ‘Australian Film’ (Scott Murray ed.) Oxford University Press, 1995: p. 47.

results.title: Snake eyes
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Touchstone and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of a high profile boxing match, gaudy casino and an immanent hurricane, this essentially interior crime thriller centres around 2 friends and law enforcement agents, one of whom may or may not be corrupt. Detective Ray Santoro (Nicolas Cage) is an Atlantic City cop, willing to take a bribe, dreaming of being on television, and always getting results. He meets his long time friend, Navy Commander Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), ringside, at a heavyweight bought signalling the swan song of the Atlantic City arena, where they, along with thousands of spectators witness the political assassination of the U.S Secretary of Defence. The stadium is shut down as Santoro leads the investigation, searching for a mysterious woman (Carla Gugion) seen speaking to the secretary shortly before he was killed. Dunne, meanwhile, is taking credit for locating the shooter, a Palestinian fall guy. As Santoro finds his witness, he learns of a conspiracy involving the Norfolk testing and learns the shocking truth about his friend. With state of the art surveillance equipment in the stadium, all eyes are watching proceeding and nothing can escape detection. When the truth is finally revealed, Santoro is forced to question his loyalty to Dunne, and whether he will live up to his reputation as a corrupt cop. Cast also includes John Heard, Stan Shaw and Michael Rispoli.

results.title: Smoking: the choice is yours
results.creator_credit: John Ewing and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A Disney animated production dealing with some of the issues of smoking. The central character decides to try smoking in an effort to gain respect from others. A courtroom scene occurs where the pros and cons of smoking are debated and eventually the hero decides not to smoke. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Snail mail
results.creator_credit: Mike Edwards, Hazel Edwards and Tellit
results.brief_description: Hazel Edwards reads her story to children in her living room. This is followed by question time from the children, an adult face-to-face interview and hazel visiting a school library.

results.title: Smoking and lung cancer
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: A strong indictment of medical men of smoking as a general health risk, this film follows an actual patient through his diagnosis, discussions with the surgeon, and the actual operation for the removal of a lung and the exposure of the cancer in the excised lung. Filmed at the Royal Edward Chest Hospital in Montreal.
